title: Quiz 3: Mentorship Dynamics
description: Test your grasp of mentorship concepts, the different models of mentoring, and the stages of the mentor-mentee relationship.

questions.question: What is a defining characteristic of a mentorship relationship?

options.text: It always occurs within a line manager-employee relationship.
It is strictly for technical skills training.
It is personal and crosses job boundaries.
It focuses on past performance failures.

questions.explanation: Mentorship is characterized by being personal, crossing job boundaries, and often taking place outside a direct line manager relationship.
questions.hint: Mentorship is broader than just a job role.

questions.question: Arrange the 4 stages of mentoring in the correct chronological order:
questions.explanation: The stages are: 1. Connection -> 2. Relationship building -> 3. Assessment/Core -> 4. Separation.
questions.hint: You meet, you build, you work, you part.

questions.question: Match the type of mentoring to its description:

pairs.right: Matches one mentor with one mentee
Mentee asks a volunteer from a list
Top down model for succession planning

questions.explanation: Definitions of the various mentoring models provided in the text.
questions.hint: Group involves multiple people; Resource involves looking up a list.

questions.question: Which of the following are qualities of a good mentor? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Good mentors are listeners, knowledgeable, non-judgmental, honest, successful, and willing to share/build trust.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ mentoring is directly tied to a training program where a mentor helps develop specific skills taught in the program.
questions.explanation: Training based mentoring is linked to a specific training program.
questions.hint: The answer is in the description.

questions.question: In the 'Separation' stage of mentoring, the mentee requires MORE guidance from the mentor.
questions.explanation: False. In the Separation stage, the mentee requires LESS guidance as their confidence and competence increase.

questions.question: Which of the following is an expectation of a Mentee during Phase 1 (Connection)?

options.text: Providing feedback to the mentor only

questions.explanation: In Phase 1, mentees expect coaching, feedback, role modelling, and acceptance/confirmation.
questions.hint: Phase 1 is about establishing the bond.

questions.question: Benefits of mentoring to the ORGANIZATION include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Mentoring improves productivity, retains experience, breaks down silos, and creates a mentoring culture. It reduces (not increases) turnover costs.
questions.hint: Think about what makes a company stronger.

questions.question: What is the term for a person who takes charge of their own development and sees real value in learning from others?
questions.explanation: A Mentee is defined as a person who takes charge of their own development and learns from others.

questions.question: Resource-based mentoring usually has strong support within an organization and always results in perfect matching.
questions.explanation: False. The text states resource-based mentoring has 'limited support' and may result in 'mismatched' pairing.
questions.hint: It's often ad-hoc and less structured.
